question: Which of the following sentences is in the Active Voice?
correct: I am cooking Maggie.
options: Maggie is being cooked by me.
The road is being made.
I am cooking Maggie.
Chocolates were eaten by me.

question: What is the correct passive form of the sentence: 'I watch TV'?
correct: TV is watched by me.
options: TV watches me.
I am watched by TV.
TV is watched by me.
TV was watched by me.

question: The sentence 'Valorant was played by me' is an example of:
correct: Passive Voice
options: Active Voice
Passive Voice
Future Tense
Present Continuous Tense

question: In the passive voice, the main verb is always in which form?
correct: The past participle (V3)
options: The simple present (V1)
The simple past (V2)
The present participle (-ing)
The past participle (V3)

question: What is the correct passive form of the sentence: 'I ate chocolates'?
correct: Chocolates were eaten by me.
options: Chocolates are eaten by me.
Chocolates were eaten by me.
Chocolates was eaten by me.
I was eaten by chocolates.

question: In the sentence 'English is taught by the teacher', who is performing the action of teaching?
correct: The teacher
options: English
The student
The teacher
It is unknown
topic: Identifying the Agent in Passive Voice

question: According to the lesson, when is the passive voice often used?
correct: When the object of the action is more important or the subject is unknown.
options: When you want to make a sentence shorter.
When the object of the action is more important or the subject is unknown.
Only when writing about historical events.
When the subject of the action is a person.

question: Convert the following sentence into passive voice: 'I will play the game.'
correct: The game will be played by me.
options: The game is played by me.
The game will be played by me.
The game was played by me.
The game will play me.

question: Which sentence correctly uses the passive voice to emphasize the 'Maggie'?
correct: Maggie is being cooked by me.
options: I am cooking Maggie.
Maggie cooks me.
By me, Maggie is being cooked.
Maggie is being cooked by me.

question: What is the active voice form of: 'The house was cleaned by me'?
correct: I cleaned the house.
options: I clean the house.
I am cleaning the house.
The house cleaned me.
I cleaned the house.

question: Convert the following sentence into passive voice: 'I am cleaning my house.'
correct: My house is being cleaned by me.
options: My house is cleaned by me.
My house was being cleaned by me.
My house is being cleaned by me.
Cleaning is being done to my house.

question: Why would a news headline say 'A new hospital was built' instead of 'A construction company built a new hospital'?
correct: Because the hospital is the important information, not the specific company.
options: Because it is a grammar rule for all news.
Because the construction company is a secret.
Because the hospital is the important information, not the specific company.
Because the active voice sentence is too long.

question: Choose the correct passive form for: 'She is writing letters.'
correct: Letters are being written by her.
options: Letters is being written by her.
Letters were written by her.
Letters are written by her.
Letters are being written by her.
topic: Present Continuous Tense with Plural Object

question: Convert the sentence 'They will not take the class' into passive voice.
correct: The class will not be taken by them.
options: The class is not taken by them.
The class will not be taken by them.
The class was not taken by them.
They will not be taken by the class.

question: What is the correct passive form for: 'I have eaten the Maggie.'?
correct: The Maggie has been eaten by me.
options: The Maggie is eaten by me.
The Maggie was being eaten by me.
The Maggie have been eaten by me.
The Maggie has been eaten by me.

question: Convert the sentence 'Anaya had been scolded' back into the active voice.
correct: Someone had scolded Anaya.
options: Anaya was scolding.
Anaya had scolded someone.
Someone had scolded Anaya.
Scolding happened to Anaya.
topic: Past Perfect Tense Conversion (Passive to Active)

question: What is the correct passive form for 'I will have played the match'?
correct: The match will have been played by me.
options: The match will be played by me.
The match would have been played by me.
The match will have been played by me.
The match has been played by me.

question: The teacher said: 'The national football championship is being played.' This passive construction is used because:
correct: The event itself is more important than naming every single player.
options: The teacher forgot who was playing.
It's impossible to list all the players' names in one sentence.
The event itself is more important than naming every single player.
The active voice is grammatically incorrect in this context.

question: Which of these sentences contains a passive voice verb in the past continuous tense?
correct: Maggie was being cooked when the phone rang.
options: Maggie was cooked.
Maggie has been cooked.
Maggie is being cooked.
Maggie was being cooked when the phone rang.

question: The sentence 'The new rules were announced' is in the passive voice. What does this structure allow the writer to do?
correct: Avoid specifying who announced the rules.
options: Prove that the rules are important.
Make the sentence sound more personal.
Avoid specifying who announced the rules.
Insist that everyone must follow the rules.
topic: Critical Analysis of Passive Voice Function
